result.execSummary:
The defendant Andy J Buttke was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Maintain FTE/schooling or combination of the two.  If not fully engaged, perform 9 hours of community service per week.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been electronically sent to the probation office.

Counseling, assessment, treatment as deemed appropriate by agent including SAFE program.  DNA sample.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Clerk Charli
Case Called: 3:29 p.m.

State appears by ADA Kyle Mayo.  Def appears in person with Atty Cana Laska.  
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed.  VRCW.

State moves to:
Ct. 1- Criminal Damage to Property-- DA>> DRI
COURT grants above.

PLEA:
Ct. 2- Disorderly Conduct- DA>> NO CONTEST

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis, & def guilty. 

COURT ORDERS: S/H 1 year probation; CONDITIONS: Counseling/Assessment/Counseling as deemed appropriate by agent including SAFE program assessment; DNA Sample and Surcharge; Maintain fulltime employment/schooling or combination of the two, if not fully engaged, perform 9 hours of CS per week; DA surcharge; CC.

COURT notes no restitution has been requested.
COURT Orders 2 days credit if revoked.

Adj: 3:37 p.m.
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 5, 2016 at 03:15 pm.
Request For Adjournment of Jury Trial on 2/22/16 - granted

Clerk Marisa.
